page.title: 16Ravenstone
page.content: {Ravenstone,}mentioned in the original Domesday Book is closely linked with Packington. Although now in Leicestershire, it was part of Derbyshire as late as 1885. At that time the major landowning family, the {FOSBROOKES,}resided at Shardlow in Derbyshire. The church, built in 1323, has a Rector, and is closely linked to a group of 26 dwellings called 'The Hospital', providing accommodation for widows and spinsters of the parish. The building had its own Chaplain (until 1950) and Chapel, where a weekly service is still conducted. In the North-West Leicestershire District Council Structure Plan (1971-1991) Ravenstone is classed as a "restraint" village.
